result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin M. Andersen

records.addlTxt: Bond applied to fines  owing in 22CT03

21CM69, 22CM3 and 22CT3.  3:38 PM Defendant Kevin M. Andersen in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video.  Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Kevin M. Andersen. Drew Waterman appeared by video.  Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. 21CM69 State withdraws motion to revoke and will be dismissing.  CT grants motion to withdraw motion and dismisses 21CM69 w/o prej and w/o costs.  Ct goes over plea questionnaire.  DE pleads G to Count 1 and Count 4 on file 22CT3.  CT finds DE FVI&K enters plea on Count 1 and Count 4, finds DE G and enters Judgment.  
count 2 merged and dismissed w/o prej and w/o costs on file 22CT3. Count 3 RID and file 22CT3.   All Counts in file 22CM3 RID w/o prej and w/o costs.  ADA Wood Webster addresses CT.  DE addresses CT.  DWaterman addresses CT.   4:13 adj. 


SENTENCING:

22CT3 - COUNT 1 - 8 days PCJ subj to GT and subj to WR.  AODA assessment and comply - AODA already taken and qualifies, will not need to retake.  Absolute Sobriety.  Driver Safety plan.  12 month revocation, 12 month IID.  $1429 fine/costs, which includes IID and DNA fee, 60 DTP or set up PP w/COC office, Judgment or TI.  Credit for 2 days.  Immediately eligible for WR.  Must report to PCJ by September 14, 2022 by 5:00 p.m.  


22CT3 - Count 4 - W/H sentence probati8on up to 1 year.  If agent feels everything is good after 6 months can have early discharge.  AODA and follow through, No Alcohol.  No abusive contact w/Victim.  $200 DNA SC and $265.60 fine/costs.   Sign up with probation by end of day Monday.  PCR given.
